## Summary of the new feature/enhancement

<!-- 
A clear and concise description of what the problem is that the new feature would solve.
Try formulating it in user story style (if applicable):
'As a user I want X so that Y.' with X being the being the action and Y being the value of the action.
-->

Take a look at this guide:
https://www.twilio.com/blog/2017/08/working-with-environment-variables-in-node-js.html

The example they used:

```bash
PORT=9999 node server.js
```

which sets `$env:PORT` to `9999` for the subprocess, `node`.

This works in bash, zsh, and fish... and is used _everywhere_. But it doesn't work in PowerShell.

The equivalent in PowerShell would be:

```
PS > $env:PORT = 9999
PS > node server.js
```

but that would set `$env:PORT` for the _current_ process as well which could cause issues.

## Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

<!-- 
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.
Consider providing an example PowerShell experience with expected result.
-->

If possible, we should try to support this syntax exactly. I couldn't find a specific doc, but this SO sums it up well:
https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/392050/set-environment-variable-for-subshell
